Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2010 10:15AM Shaysmom wrote: I now on the one form for my student loans the oncologist put terminal. She explained sometimes how they have to word things (that was 8 years ago) . I was like aren't we all terminal. Everybody is going to die someday.  Hope it goes through for you.
Posts.Title: WTF accelerated benefits Fitztwins Shaysmom

Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2010 11:19AM Shaysmom wrote: My bloodwork is almost always normal. Only thing that was ever abnormal was by C reacting (???) rate with my initial dx. That only means there is an inflammation in your body and is more indicitative of lyme disease. I was dxed with lobular breast cancer so I had a thickened area not a true lump but I had just had a baby so they thought it was from that.  Since then except for anemia that I have always had everything is normal with bloodwork. I have had mets for 7 years. Stable from 10/01 until 11/09.
